Line 28: Line 28:
Mac is 19, a [[Sagittarius]] and her hometown is Neptune, [[California]].<ref name="myspace">[http://www.myspace.com/vmarsmac MySpace.com - MAC - 20 - Fille - Neptune, Alabama - www.myspace.com/vmarsmac<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> True to the show's spirit of moral grey areas, in the episode where Mac is introduced, she helps Veronica find out who has stolen her password and has created a false score under her name on a purity test that had become a brief fad at Neptune High. The moral ambiguity of the show is best shown in the fact that Mac, although a friend of Veronica's, is the person who created the test in the first place, thus making it possible for the "sex crazed 09ers" to access other people's purity tests - and thus is also responsible for the chaos which is the focus of this episode.
Mac is 19, a [[Sagittarius]] and her hometown is Neptune, [[California]].<ref name="myspace">[http://www.myspace.com/vmarsmac MySpace.com - MAC - 20 - Fille - Neptune, Alabama - www.myspace.com/vmarsmac<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> True to the show's spirit of moral grey areas, in the episode where Mac is introduced, she helps Veronica find out who has stolen her password and has created a false score under her name on a purity test that had become a brief fad at Neptune High. The moral ambiguity of the show is best shown in the fact that Mac, although a friend of Veronica's, is the person who created the test in the first place, thus making it possible for the "sex crazed 09ers" to access other people's purity tests - and thus is also responsible for the chaos which is the focus of this episode.
â
Like Veronica, Mac uses an [[Apple Computer|Apple]] [[PowerBook]] and in season three, a [[MacBook Pro]]. Mac vehemently defends the [[Mac OS X]] operating system (in the episode "[[Weapons of Class Destruction]]") in an argument with an [[Ubuntu (Linux distribution)|Ubuntu Linux]] fan.
+
Like Veronica, Mac uses an [[Apple Computer|Apple]] [[PowerBook]] and in season three, a [[MacBook Pro]]. Mac vehemently defends the [[Mac OS X]] operating system (in the episode "[[Weapons of Class Destruction]]") in an argument with an [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]] fan.
Mac has always felt she did not belong in her family; Veronica discovers that Mac was [[babies switched at birth|switched at birth]] with [[Madison Sinclair]]. Since the mistake was uncovered four years after the births, the parents decided to keep the children. Each family received a handsome cash settlement from the hospital. While Madison's family invested and flourished, Mac's started a business and went [[bankruptcy|bankrupt]].
